clinical_study.brief_title: Co-Administration of Meningococcal Vaccine GSK134612 With Infanrix Hexa™ Versus Individual Administration of Each Vaccine
clinical_study.official_title: Co-Administration of GSK Biologicals' Meningococcal Vaccine GSK134612 With Infanrix Hexa™, Compared to Individual Administration of Each Vaccine, in Healthy 12- Through 23-Month-Old Children

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to demonstrate, in 12-23 months old subjects, the non-inferiority of meningococcal vaccine GSK134612 co-administered with Infanrix hexa™, compared to each vaccine administered individually and to licensed meningococcal vaccine Meningitec™.
The Protocol Posting has been updated in order to comply with the FDA Amendment Act, Sep 2007.

detailed_description.textblock:
Multicentre study with 4 parallel groups. One group will receive GSK134612 co-administered with Infanrix hexa™, two groups will receive sequential administration of GSK134612 and Infanrix hexa™ and the final group will receive Meningitec™.
For subjects in Groups B and C, three blood samples will be taken: prior to first vaccination and 1 month after each vaccination.
For subjects in Groups A and D, two blood samples will be taken: prior to and 1 month after vaccination.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With rSBA-MenA, rSBA-MenC, rSBA-MenW-135 and rSBA-MenY Titers ≥ the Cut-off.
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month after vaccination with Nimenrix vaccine (Month 1)
primary_outcome.description: The cut-off for the assay was greater than or equal to (≥) 1:8. The analysis was based only on subjects receiving Nimenrix vaccination at Day 0.

The analysis was based only on subjects receiving Infanrix-hexa vaccination. The results were calculated as geometric mean expressed in enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) units per milliliter (EL.U/mL).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Anti-HBs Concentrations ≥ the Cut-off
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month after vaccination with Nimenrix vaccine (Month 1)
primary_outcome.description: The cut-off for the assay was greater than or equal to (≥) 10 milli-interantional units per milliliter (mIU/mL).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Anti-PRP Concentrations ≥ the Cut-off
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month after vaccination with Nimenrix vaccine (Month 1)
primary_outcome.description: The cut-off for the assay was ≥ 1μg/mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With rSBA-MenA, rSBA-MenC, rSBA-MenW-135 and rSBA-MenY Titers ≥ the Cut-off Values
secondary_outcome.description: The cut-off values for the assay were ≥ 1:8 and ≥ 1:128

secondary_outcome.measure: rSBA-MenA, rSBA-MenC, rSBA-MenW-135 and rSBA-MenY Titers
secondary_outcome.description: The results were tabulated as geometric mean expressed in titers.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Anti-polysaccharide A (Anti-PSA), Anti-PSC, Anti-PSW, and Anti-PSY ≥ the Cut-off
secondary_outcome.description: The cut-off for the assay were ≥ 0.3 microgram per milliliter (μg/mL) and ≥ 2.0 μg/mL, respectively.

secondary_outcome.measure: Anti-polysaccharide A (Anti-PSA), Anti-PSC, Anti-PSW, and Anti-PSY Antibody Concentrations
secondary_outcome.description: The results for the assay were tabulated as geometric mean expressed in microgram per milliliter (μg/mL).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Seroprotected Subjects for Anti-tetanus Toxoid (Anti-TT)
secondary_outcome.description: The cut-off for the assay was ≥ 0.1

secondary_outcome.measure: Anti-tetanus Toxoid (Anti-TT) Antibody Concentrations
secondary_outcome.description: The results for the assay were tabulated as geometric mean expressed in internationl units per milliliter (IU/mL).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Seroprotected for Anti-diphtheria (Anti-D) ≥ the Cut-off
secondary_outcome.description: The cut-off for the assay was ≥ 0.1

secondary_outcome.measure: Anti-diphtheria (Anti-D) Antibody Concentrations
secondary_outcome.description: The results for the assay were tabulated as geometric mean expressed in internationl units per milliliter (IU/mL).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Seroprotected for Anti-polio Type 1, 2 & 3 ≥ the Cut-off
secondary_outcome.description: The cut-off for the assay was ≥ 1:8.

secondary_outcome.measure: Anti-polio Type 1, 2 & 3 Titers
secondary_outcome.description: The results for the assay were tabulated as geometric mean expressed in titers.

secondary_outcome.measure: Numbers of Seroprotected Subjects for Anti-PRP ≥ the Cut-off
secondary_outcome.description: The cut-off for the assay was ≥ 1.0

secondary_outcome.measure: Anti-PRP Antibody Concentrations
secondary_outcome.description: The results for the assay were tabulated as geometric mean expressed in microgram per milliliter (μg/mL).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Seroprotected Subjects for Anti-HBs ≥ the Cut-offs
secondary_outcome.description: The cut-offs for the assay were ≥ 10 mIU/mL and ≥ 100 mIU/mL respectively .

secondary_outcome.measure: Anti-HBs Antibody Concentrations
secondary_outcome.description: The results for the assay were tabulated as geometric mean expressed in milli-international units per milliliter (mIU/mL).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With a Vaccine Response to PT, FHA and PRN Antigens
secondary_outcome.description: Vaccine response to these antigens is defined as appearance of antibodies in subjects who were seronegative (antibody concentration < 5 EL.U/mL) at pre-vaccination or as at least a 2-fold increase in post-over pre-vaccination antibody concentrations in subjects seropositive at pre-vaccination. The analysis was based only on subjects receiving experimental vaccination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Anti-PT, Anti-FHA and Anti-PRN Antibody Concentrations
secondary_outcome.description: The results were tabulated as geometric mean expressed in enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) units per milliliter (EL.U/mL).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting Any and Grade 3 Solicited Local Symptoms Post-meningococcal Vaccination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-day (Days 0-3) follow-up period after Nimenrix or Meningitec vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: Solicited local symptoms assessed were pain, redness and swelling. Any was defined as occurrence of any local symptom irrespective of intensity grade. Grade 3 Pain was defined as crying when limb was moved/ spontaneously painful.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting Any and Grade 3 Solicited Local Symptoms Post-combined Diphtheria Vaccination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-day (Days 0-3) follow-up period after Infanrix-hexa vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: The analysis was based only on subjects receiving combined-diphtheria vaccination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting Any Solicited General Symptoms Following Each Dose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-day (Days 0-3) post-vaccination dose 1 (D1) and second dose (D2)
secondary_outcome.description: Solicited general symptoms assessed were drowsiness, fever, irritability and loss of appetite. Any was defined as occurrence of any general symptom irrespective of intensity grade and relationship. Subjects in the Nimenrix + Infanrix-hexa Group did not receive a second dose of vaccination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting Any Rash
secondary_outcome.description: Any was defined as occurrence of at least one symptom experienced.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting Any New Onset of Chronic Illnesses (NOCIs)
secondary_outcome.description: Any was defined as occurrence of at least one symptom experienced.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting Any Conditions Prompting Emergency Room Visits (ER)
secondary_outcome.description: Any was defined as occurrence of at least one symptom experienced.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting Any Unsolicited Adverse Events (AEs) After the First Dose
secondary_outcome.description: An AE is any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation subject, temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product. "Any" was defined as an incidence of an unsolicited AE regardless of intensity or relationship to study vaccination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting Any Unsolicited Adverse Events (AEs) After the Second Dose
secondary_outcome.description: An AE is any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation subject, temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product. "Any" was defined as an incidence of an unsolicited AE regardless of intensity or relationship to study vaccination. The analysis was based only on subjects receiving a second dose of vaccination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting Any Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From dose 1 (Month 0) up to study end (Month 7)
secondary_outcome.description: Serious adverse events (SAEs) assessed include medical occurrences that result in death, are life threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization or result in disability/ incapacity.

arm_group.description: Meningococcal vaccine GSK134612 co-administered with Infanrix hexa™
Meningococcal vaccine GSK134612 followed one month later by Infanrix hexa™
Infanrix hexa™ followed one month later by Meningococcal vaccine GSK134612

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who the investigator believes that their parents/guardians can and will comply with the requirements of the protocol.
- A male or female between, and including, 12 and 23 months of age at the time of the first vaccination.
- Written informed consent obtained from the parent or guardian of the subject.
- Free of obvious health problems as established by medical history and clinical examination before entering into the study.
- Documented three-dose primary vaccination with DTPa, hepatitis B, inactivated polio and Haemophilus influenzae type b conjugate vaccines, completed at least 180 days before administration of the first study vaccination.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Use of any investigational or non-registered product (drug or vaccine) other than the study vaccines within 30 days preceding the first dose of study vaccine, or planned use during the study period.
- Chronic administration (defined as more than 14 days) of immunosuppressants or other immune-modifying drugs within six months prior to the first vaccine dose.
- Planned administration/ administration of any vaccine not foreseen by the study protocol, including measles, mumps, rubella, varicella and pneumococcal vaccines, within 30 days before the first dose of vaccine(s) and 30 days after the last dose of vaccine(s).
- Previous vaccination with meningococcal polysaccharide vaccine of serogroup A, C, W and/or Y.
- Previous vaccination with meningococcal polysaccharide conjugate vaccine of serogroup A, C, W and/or Y.
- Previous booster vaccination against diphtheria, tetanus, pertussis, hepatitis B, poliomyelitis or Haemophilus influenzae type b.
- History of meningococcal disease.
- Any confirmed or suspected immunosuppressive or immunodeficient condition (congenital or secondary), including human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection, based on medical history and physical examination.
- History of reactions or allergic disease likely to be exacerbated by any component of the vaccine(s).
- Major congenital defects or serious chronic illness.
- Acute disease at the time of enrolment.
- Administration of immunoglobulins and/or any blood products within the three months preceding the first dose of study vaccine or planned administration during the study period.
Additional criteria for subjects receiving Infanrix hexa™
- Hypersensitivity reaction due to previous vaccination with Infanrix hexa™.
- Encephalopathy defined as an acute, severe central nervous system disorder occurring within 7 days following vaccination and generally consisting of major alterations in consciousness, unresponsiveness, generalised or focal seizures that persist more than a few hours, with failure to recover within 24 hours.

reference.citation: Knuf M, Pantazi-Chatzikonstantinou A, Pfletschinger U, Tichmann-Schumann I, Maurer H, Maurer L, Fischbach T, Zinke H, Pankow-Culot H, Papaevangelou V, Bianco V, Van der Wielen M, Miller JM. An investigational tetravalent meningococcal serogroups A, C, W-135 and Y-tetanus toxoid conjugate vaccine co-administered with Infanrix™ hexa is immunogenic, with an acceptable safety profile in 12-23-month-old children. Vaccine. 2011 Jun 6;29(25):4264-73. doi: 10.1016/j.vaccine.2011.03.009. Epub 2011 Mar 21.

Maurer H et al. Co-administration of MENACWY-TT conjugate vaccine with DTPA-HBV-IPV/HIB vaccine does not impair immune response to DTPA-HBV-IPV/HIB, and has an acceptable safety profile. Abstract presented at the 28th Annual Meeting of European Society for Paediatric Infectious Diseases (ESPID). Nice, France, 4-8 May 2010.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: During the screening the following steps occurred: check for inclusion/ exclusion criteria, contraindications/ precautions, medical history of the subjects and signing informed consent forms.

group.title: Nimenrix + Infanrix-hexa Group
group.description: Subjects received concomitant administration of 1 dose of Nimenrix™ and Infanrix-hexa™ vaccines at Day 0.

group.title: Nimenrix Group
group.description: Subjects received a single dose of Nimenrix™ vaccine at Day 0, followed one month later by 1 dose of Infanrix-hexa™ vaccine.

group.title: Infanrix-Hexa Group
group.description: Subjects received a single dose of Infanrix-Hexa™ vaccine at Day 0, followed one month later by 1 dose of Nimenrix™ vaccine.

group.title: Meningitec Group
group.description: Subjects received 1 dose of Meningitec™ vaccine at Day 0 and were permitted to receive the routinely recommended Infanrix-hexa booster once the active safety follow-up of this study was completed.

analysis.groups_desc: Demonstration of the non-inferiority of Nimenrix vaccine co-administered with combined Infanrix-hexa vaccine given alone in terms of bactericidal antibodies to Neisseria meningitidis serogroup A, at month 1.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Criterion for non-inferiority: The lower limit of the two-sided standardized asymptotic 95% confidence interval (CI) for the group difference in the percentages of subjects with serum bactericidal antibodies using baby rabbit complement (rSBA) titer ≥1:8 is greater than or equal to the pre-defined clinical limit of -10%.

analysis.groups_desc: Demonstration of the non-inferiority of the Nimenrix vaccine co-administered with combined Infanrix-hexa vaccine given alone in terms of bactericidal antibodies to Neisseria meningitidis serogroup C, at month 1.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Criterion for non-inferiority: The lower limit of the two-sided standardized asymptotic 95% confidence interval (CI) for the group difference in the percentages of subjects with serum bactericidal antibodies using baby rabbit complement (rSBA) titer ≥1:8 is greater than or equal to the pre-defined clinical limit of -10%.

analysis.groups_desc: Demonstration of the non-inferiority of the Nimenrix vaccine co-administered with combined Infanrix-hexa vaccine given alone in terms of bactericidal antibodies to Neisseria meningitidis serogroup W-135, at month 1.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Criterion for non-inferiority: The lower limit of the two-sided standardized asymptotic 95% confidence interval (CI) for the group difference in the percentages of subjects with serum bactericidal antibodies using baby rabbit complement (rSBA) titer ≥1:8 is greater than or equal to the pre-defined clinical limit of -10%.

analysis.groups_desc: Demonstration of the non-inferiority of the Nimenrix vaccine co-administered with combined Infanrix-hexa vaccine given alone in terms of bactericidal antibodies to Neisseria meningitidis serogroup Y, at month 1.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Criterion for non-inferiority: The lower limit of the two-sided standardized asymptotic 95% confidence interval (CI) for the group difference in the percentages of subjects with serum bactericidal antibodies using baby rabbit complement (rSBA) titer ≥1:8 is greater than or equal to the pre-defined clinical limit of -10%.

analysis.groups_desc: Demonstration of non-inferiority of combined Infanrix-hexa vaccine co-administered with Nimenrix vaccine to Infanrix-hexa vaccine given alone in terms of geometric mean concentrations (GMCs) of antibodies to pertussis toxoid (PT), at month 1.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Criterion for non-inferiority (1 month after the first study vaccination): The lower limit of the two-sided 95% CI on the GMC ratio for anti-PT (ELISA) is greater than or equal to a pre-defined clinical limit of delta = 0.67.

analysis.groups_desc: Demonstration of non-inferiority of combined Infanrix-hexa vaccine co-administered with Nimenrix vaccine to Infanrix-hexa vaccine given alone in terms of geometric mean concentrations (GMCs) of antibodies to filamentous haemagglutinin (FHA), at month 1.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Criterion for non-inferiority (1 month after the first study vaccination): The lower limit of the two-sided 95% CI on the GMC ratio for anti-FHA (ELISA) is greater than or equal to a pre-defined clinical limit of delta = 0.67.

analysis.groups_desc: Demonstration of non-inferiority of combined Infanrix-hexa vaccine co-administered with Nimenrix vaccine to Infanrix-hexa vaccine given alone in terms of geometric mean concentrations (GMCs) of antibodies to pertactin (PRN), at month 1.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Criterion for non-inferiority (1 month after the first study vaccination): The lower limit of the two-sided 95% CI on the GMC ratio for anti-PRN (ELISA) is greater than or equal to a pre-defined clinical limit of delta = 0.67.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With a Vaccine Response to PT, FHA and PRN Antigens
outcome.description: Vaccine response to these antigens is defined as appearance of antibodies in subjects who were seronegative (antibody concentration < 5 EL.U/mL) at pre-vaccination or as at least a 2-fold increase in post-over pre-vaccination antibody concentrations in subjects seropositive at pre-vaccination. The analysis was based only on subjects receiving experimental vaccination.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the ATP cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects for whom assay results were available for antibodies against at least one study vaccine antigen component prior to (M0) and after vaccination (M1).

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Any and Grade 3 Solicited Local Symptoms Post-meningococcal Vaccination
outcome.description: Solicited local symptoms assessed were pain, redness and swelling. Any was defined as occurrence of any local symptom irrespective of intensity grade. Grade 3 Pain was defined as crying when limb was moved/ spontaneously painful.
outcome.time_frame: During the 4-day (Days 0-3) follow-up period after Nimenrix or Meningitec vaccination
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort (TVC), which included all vaccinated subjects with the symptom sheet filled-in after meningococcal vaccination.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Any Solicited General Symptoms Following Each Dose
outcome.description: Solicited general symptoms assessed were drowsiness, fever, irritability and loss of appetite. outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort (TVC), which included all vaccinated subjects with the symptom sheet filled-in.

outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort (TVC), which included all vaccinated subjects.

group.title: Nimenrix + Infanrix-hexa Group
group.description: Subjects received concomitant administration of 1 dose of Nimenrix™ and Infanrix-hexa™ vaccines at Day 0.

group.title: Nimenrix Group
group.description: Subjects received a single dose of Nimenrix™ vaccine at Day 0, followed one month later by 1 dose of Infanrix-hexa™ vaccine.

group.title: Infanrix-Hexa Group
group.description: Subjects received a single dose of Infanrix-Hexa™ vaccine at Day 0, followed one month later by 1 dose of Nimenrix™ vaccine.

group.title: Meningitec Group
group.description: Subjects received 1 dose of Meningitec™ vaccine at Day 0 and were permitted to receive the routinely recommended Infanrix-hexa booster once the active safety follow-up of this study was completed.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Any Unsolicited Adverse Events (AEs) After the First Dose
outcome.description: An AE is any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation subject, temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product. "Any" was defined as an incidence of an unsolicited AE regardless of intensity or relationship to study vaccination.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort (TVC), which included all vaccinated subjects.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Any Unsolicited Adverse Events (AEs) After the Second Dose
outcome.description: An AE is any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation subject, temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product. "Any" was defined as an incidence of an unsolicited AE regardless of intensity or relationship to study vaccination. The analysis was based only on subjects receiving a second dose of vaccination.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort (TVC), which included all vaccinated subjects with the symptom sheet filled-in.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Any Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
outcome.description: Serious adverse events (SAEs) assessed include medical occurrences that result in death, are life threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization or result in disability/ incapacity.
outcome.time_frame: From dose 1 (Month 0) up to study end (Month 7)
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort (TVC), which included all vaccinated subjects.

measure.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Any Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
measure.description: Serious adverse events (SAEs) assessed include medical occurrences that result in death, are life threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization or result in disability/ incapacity.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort (TVC), which included all vaccinated subjects.

reported_events.time_frame: SAEs were reported throughout the entire study period (Day 0 - Month 7). Solicited symptoms were reported during a 4-day period (Day 0-Day 3) after any vaccine dose, while unsolicited AEs were collected within 31 days (Days 0-30) after vaccination.
reported_events.desc: The solicited local and general symptoms were only collected for those subjects who filled-in their symptom sheets.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
